text: Gail Sontgerath (born March 11, 1944) is an American gymnast. She was the 1960 U.S. Women's National Amateur Athletic Union Gymastics Champion. She competed in six events at the 1960 Summer Olympics. Raised in Dover, New Jersey, Sontgerath moved to Florida as a child, graduating from Palm Beach High School and Florida State University.Robb, Sharon. "Then and Now", Sun-Sentinel, June 2, 1996. Accessed August 3, 2019. "Hometown: Dover, N.J." In March 1961, she appeared a mystery contestant on the television quiz show To Tell the Truth, where she was described as the highest scoring U.S. women's gymnast at the 1960 Summer Olympics. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:American female artistic gymnasts Category:Florida State University alumni Category:People from Dover, New Jersey Category:Sportspeople from Morris County, New Jersey Category:Olympic gymnasts of the United States Category:Gymnasts at the 1960 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from New Jersey
title: Gail Sontgerath
